main event: A sighting of flashing red, green, and amber lights occurred on February 18, 1956, in Burlington, North Carolina.
interesting points: The lights appeared stationary at first before moving 1 mile north., The observation lasted for 4 minutes., Three lights were observed during the sighting., It was determined that the lights were likely related to aircraft activity due to the presence of two civilian airports nearby., The report concluded that the sighting was probably an aircraft or a balloon.
sighted object: flashing red, green, and amber lights
witness description: Mr. Joe M. Rogers and two civilian aides
